meanings.definition: A person who is known for their playful or mischievous behavior.
meanings.sent1: The group of cutups in the class always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The kids at the party were a bunch of cutups, playing pranks on each other.
meanings.sent3: The cutups at the office decided to surprise their boss with a funny dance routine.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a real cutup, always finding ways to make people smile.
meanings.sent5: The comedy show was a hit thanks to the talented cutups on stage.

meanings.definition: A piece of paper or fabric that has been cut into a decorative shape.
meanings.sent1: She used colorful cutups to create a beautiful collage.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed making various cutups during the arts and crafts session.
meanings.sent3: The artist used intricate cutups to design a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: The room was adorned with delicate cutups hanging from the ceiling.
meanings.sent5: The gift was wrapped in a lovely paper with floral cutups.

meanings.definition: To cut or tear something into pieces.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cutups the paper to make a snowflake.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to cutups the vegetables quickly for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally cutups his shirt while trying to fix it.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind can easily cutups the fragile leaves from the tree.
